citations.title: Bundle up: Tips for driving your GM EV in winter
citations.summary: GM electric vehicles are equipped with an advanced thermal management system that regulates battery temperature to ensure optimal performance and longevity. This system automatically adjusts the battery's temperature during charging, warming it in cold conditions and cooling it in hot weather. Additionally, the Eco Climate mode enhances energy efficiency by optimizing cabin heating and cooling.

citations.title: GM and Wolfspeed develop domestically-sourced EV ...
citations.summary: General Motors is collaborating with Wolfspeed to enhance its Ultium battery platform, which powers a range of vehicles from mass-market to high-performance models. The partnership focuses on the adoption of silicon carbide semiconductors, which improve system efficiency, extend EV range, and reduce weight and space requirements. Wolfspeed's technology supports electric propulsion systems across a voltage range from 400V to 800V, facilitating the automotive industry's shift towards clean energy vehicles.

citations.title: GM to invest $888 million in Tonawanda Propulsion plant
citations.summary: General Motors is investing $888 million in its Tonawanda Propulsion plant to facilitate the production of the sixth generation of V-8 engines, designed for full-size trucks and SUVs. This new engine generation aims to enhance performance while improving fuel economy and reducing emissions, with advancements in combustion and thermal management technology playing a crucial role in these enhancements.

citations.title: Ultium Energy Recovery Can Help GM EVs Charge and ...
citations.summary: GM's Ultium energy recovery system utilizes a patented heat pump to capture and repurpose waste heat generated by EV batteries and propulsion components, enhancing vehicle efficiency by powering heating and propulsion while conserving range. This technology, which builds on concepts from GM's early EV, the EV1, is protected by 11 patents and is integrated into all current and future Ultium vehicles. Additionally, the system can harness humidity and body heat from passengers to further optimize energy use.

citations.title: GM's path to full autonomy: Building trust step-by-step
citations.summary: General Motors is advancing its autonomous driving capabilities by expanding its fleet of vehicles that collect real-world data, accumulating thousands of miles daily alongside millions of miles in simulations. This effort is part of a broader strategy to build trust in their autonomous systems, such as the Super Cruise feature, which requires active plans or trials for use. The company emphasizes the importance of driver attention and safety, particularly when utilizing advanced features like Lane Change on Demand and Automatic Lane Change.

citations.title: Driving America forward: For GM, 116 years and counting
citations.summary: General Motors (GM) is significantly enhancing its U.S. manufacturing capabilities with a $60 billion investment over the past five years, including a recent announcement of $4 billion allocated to expand production at three major assembly plants: Orion in Michigan, Fairfax in Kansas, and Spring Hill in Tennessee. This investment aims to bolster the production capacity for both internal combustion and electric vehicles, supporting nearly one million American jobs across its 50 facilities in 17 states.

TRL.rationale: The 800V platform and associated technologies are in advanced stages of development, with operational systems in place for high-performance EVs. However, full operational deployment and validation in diverse environments are still ongoing.

MRL.rationale: The manufacturing readiness for the 800V platform is progressing, with significant investments in production facilities such as the Tonawanda Propulsion plant. However, full-rate production has not yet been demonstrated for all components.
